questions.question: You ........................... slow down. (Order)
questions.description: Must shows strong obligation. It is also used to give orders.

questions.question: You ............................... go shopping this week.
questions.description: Need not shows lack of necessity. You have to use a to-infinitive after do not need.

questions.question: .................................. we throw a party next week?  (Make a suggestion)
questions.description: Shall we is used to make a suggestion.

questions.question: ........................... I carry your bag? (Make an offer)
questions.description: Should I is used to make offers.

questions.question: You .............................. to wake me up early tomorrow. I am on holiday. (Lack of necessity)
questions.description: Before a to-infinitive, use do not need....

questions.question: You ............................... pack so many clothes. We are only going for one day. (Lack of necessity)
I love music. I ............................. play the piano really well. (Ability)
I lost my phone yesterday but I ................................ find it. (Ability)
questions.description: Could is not wrong here. To say that you managed to do something on one occasion, use be able to.

questions.question: She ............................. walk when she was just 8 months old. (Past ability)
questions.description: Use could to talk about past ability in general.
